summary: Out of the Wormhole: Trauma and the Self in Iron Man 3
title: Out of the Wormhole: Trauma and the Self in Iron Man 3
excerpt: Maybe you never really leave the wormhole. Maybe trauma is something to learn to live with, side by side, and not to overcome. Iron Man 3, for all its silliness and strangeness and morally questionable underpinnings, offers less a manual on how to do that than a rough and complicated picture of what that might look like.
description:
Steve Rogers, referring to Natasha Romanoff’s fluid relationship to truth, remarks, “That’s a tough way to live.” Natasha—like Tony, when presented with the argument that his suits are a distraction—doesn’t argue. Instead she says, almost absently, “It’s a good way not to die, though.”

A tough way to live can be a good way not to die, and vice versa. The suits serve a complicated function. They keep Tony in his basement, away from his loved ones, frantically tinkering away without sleep for days on end; they literally come between him and the person who cares about him most. But it’s easy to imagine a form of distraction that would be unambiguously more damaging. 

A coping mechanism can push away or even hurt the people you love, sending you deeper into the isolation of your own anxiety. A coping mechanism can keep you alive when your world is crumbling around you. These facts can coexist, uncomfortably but not in contradiction.


I just watched Endgame!!!!, and this is my favorite thing probably written about a Marvel movie, and also a very good thing about trauma. It’s good.

summary: A Big Moment
title: A Big Moment
body:
ao3  NOTE- no endgame spoilers. This is part of my asexual Peter Parker series (link) but you don’t need to read those first. 

“You have to tell him,” Tony says simply.

Peter nods, running his hands through his hair, “I know.” Tony sighs and passes Peter a glass of water. Peter takes a sip.

“What if he breaks up with me?” Peter asks quietly.

Tony puts a hand on Peter’s shoulder, “Then it’s for the best. Do you really want to be with someone who doesn’t accept you as you are?”

Peter sighs, “I know. I’ll tell him when he gets here, okay?”

Tony nods, “Alright, kid.”

Tony gives Peter a tight hug and walks out of the room, leaving Peter to wait for his boyfriend.

“Is he going to tell him?” A voice asks as soon as Tony leaves the room. Tony jumps about five feet in the air. He spins around to see Steve standing there.

“What the hell, Rogers!” Tony exclaims. Tony puts his hand on his chest and takes a slow breath.

Steve doesn’t apologize, “Is he going to tell Harry?” Steve asks.

“Yes,” Tony responds and he begins to walk away. “I’m planning on listening in if you want to join me.” Steve follows Tony.

…

“Mr. Osborn is here, Peter,” FRIDAY says. Peter takes a deep breath and rubs his hands on his pants.

Peter stands up and walks over to the elevator doors. As they open, Peter doesn’t have to fake a smile when he sees Harry. Harry grins as he steps out of the elevator. The two boys hug and quickly kiss. Harry puts his arm around Peter as they walk back into the living room. They sit down on the couch and Peter immediately curls up against Harry’s chest. Harry laughs and brushes his hand through Peter’s hair.

Peter sighs and pulls away from Harry, remembering his promise to his dad. Harry’s brow furrows at the loss of contact, but he watches Peter expectantly.

“We need to talk,” Peter says. “Sorry, it’s not bad I promise, I’m not breaking up with you. Well, it’s not bad unless you react badly and then-”

“Peter.” Harry says calmly, interrupting his ramble. Harry takes his hands and gives him a suppurative smile. “Take a breath.” Harry mimes taking a deep breath and Peter copies him. “Now, what do we need to talk about.”

Peter squeezes Harry’s hands and takes another deep breath, “Um, okay, I don’t know how to begin so I’ll just say it,” Peter can feel his anxiety pressing against his chest, but he tries to ignore it. “I’m asexual.” Peter’s eyes snap up to gage Harry’s reaction. Harry is silent for a moment. Peter’s hands twitch with anxiety, waiting for his reaction.

Then Harry pulls him into a tight hug. Peter sighs in relief and hugs Harry back. They sit like that for a few minutes before Harry presses a kiss to Peter’s cheek and pulls back. Harry rests his hand on Peter’s cheek, he leans into the touch.

“Thank you for telling me, Peter,” Harry says, looking into his eyes.

“You’re not upset?” Peter asks his eyes large with anticipation.

“Of course not,” Harry says, leaning towards Peter. “Why would I be?”

Peter shrugs, “Because I’m different. Because you didn’t know that when we started dating.”

Harry just shakes his head, “You’re not different, you’re still the same to me. Who cares if I didn’t know that when we started dating. I know that now and that’s what’s important.” Peter’s eyes brim with tears as he takes in the words from his sweet, caring boyfriend. Harry tightens his hold Peter’s hands, “I want you to know that this won’t change anything about our relationship and that I still look at you the same, okay?”

Peter tackles Harry with a hug, Harry catches him with a laugh, “I love you,” Peter says.

“What?” Harry says, pulling back. Peter’s eyes grow wide as he realizes that he said that out loud. Then he realizes that was the first time he told Harry that he loved him. “Peter…” Harry whispers, his voice full of emotion, “I love you, too.” Peter face breaks open with a smile. Harry leans forward and kisses Peter before hugging him again.

…

After Harry leaves, Steve and Tony meet Peter in the kitchen for dinner. Steve begins to boil water while Tony joins Peter sitting on the kitchen counter.

“I’m proud of you, kid,” Tony says ruffling Peter’s hair. “That took guts.”

“Thanks, dad,” Peter says. “I’m assuming you were listening to the whole conversation?”

“Yep,” Tony responds with a smirk.

“Steve too?”

“Yep.” Tony says again.

Peter sighs, “And?”

Tony smiles at Peter, “He has our approval. He’s good for you, kid.”

Peter smiles, “I know.”

Marvel comic and movie verse fan works from AO3.
_____
ao3feedmonster@gmail.com

summary: They Peace They Bring
title: They Peace They Bring
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VMPu44

by Diamond4Lyfe

“Pete look at the water!” Peter snapped his head up and looked into what Morgan was trying to show him. In the water there were two figures, one was in red and the other in black. They were face up and floating next to each other.

“Are they people? What are people doing in our creek?”

“I’ll see, you stay here.” Morgan nodded as the spider boy walked to the other side of the creek. Peter could tell that it was two people in the creek, but how they got there was a mystery. From what he could see it was a man and woman, both seemed at peace, but then it was the floating of red hair that had Peter’s breath caught in his throat.

“Pete? What is it? Are they okay?”

“Morgan go back to the house and get everyone now! I think it’s Natasha and Tony!” Morgan could only nod, in shock, before her little legs carried her back to the cabin.

(Or Tony and Natasha are alive because that’s how it should’ve been.)

summary: Side Effects May Include (Tony Stark x Daughter)
title: Side Effects May Include (Tony Stark x Daughter)
body:
Side Effects May Include (Masterlist)

Part 17

Warnings: Mentions of rape and a suicide attempt

Word Count: 1,354


“You ready for some visitors?” Tony asked his daughter as she fiddled with her fingers.

“Who’s out there?” Olivia asked.

“From what I know of, Steve, Nat, Bucky, and Peter.”

Olivia couldn’t help but smile at Peter’s name, after all, he was still her only friend, “does Peter know the full story?”

Tony let out a soft chuckle, “Yeah,” he cleared his throat, “even put it upon himself to go give Bren a piece of his mind.”

“What!?”

“Probably shouldn’t have told you that,” Tony muttered.

“Probably should’ve started with that!” Olivia exclaimed, “I want to see him.”

“Of course, I am pretty sure he wants to see you too,” Tony gave his daughter a wink.

She looked at her dad with a confused expression, “what does that suppose to mean?”

“Oh, nothing,” Tony smiled, “I’ll go get, Spidey for you.”

Olivia sighed, she didn’t know how Peter was going to react when he saw her. But she knew that’s he has stayed so far, that’s all that mattered.

Tony walked out of the room, walking down the hall and into the waiting room where everyone was, “She wants to see you, Spidey.”

Earning ‘ooooo’s from everyone in the room, “someone’s in trouble,” Nat said as she took a sip of her coffee.

Peter sighed as he got up from his chair, “did you tell her what happened?”

“It might’ve slipped out,” Tony said with a smirk. Peter groaned to himself as he walked out of the waiting room with Tony. “You’ve got nothing to worry about.”

“It’s Olivia for christ’s sake, have you ever been scolded by her?”

“… You’re right, you have a lot to worry about,” Tony patted Peter’s back and then opened the door, Olivia gave her dad the look. The look that meant to leave them alone, “I’ll be in the waiting room,” Tony smiled at them both before closing door.

“Really Peter?!” Olivia threw a pillow at him, “beating up Bren!?”

Peter sighed and picked up the pillow, fluffing it a bit as he walked over to Olivia, he placed the pillow back onto Olivia’s back, “he deserved it,” he mumbled.

“You could’ve made things worse,” she whispered.

“So? I don’t regret it if anything it’s on me,” Peter said softly.

Olivia glanced at his hands, noticing the small bruises and scraps forming on his knuckles, she gently grabbed them, “you could’ve gotten hurt.”

“I’m spider-man, I’ve dealt with worse,” Olivia let out a soft chuckle. Peter couldn’t stop staring at her as she examined his hands, he couldn’t stop thinking about how beautiful she was, how he could’ve lost her, “Why didn’t you tell me?”

Olivia sighed, she gently put Peter’s hand down, “I told Jasmine,” she chuckled, “and then she said that I probably wanted it, because of rumors that were circulating in school… She decided to listen to rumors rather than her friend…”

Peter grabbed Olivia’s hand, giving it a gentle squeeze, “but I’m not Jasmine.”

“But how was I supposed to know, Peter? How was I supposed to know that you wouldn’t do the same?” Olivia felt tears well up in her eyes.

“Because I love you,” Peter blurted.

Olivia quickly turned to look at Peter, “you love me?”

“I didn’t mean to say that!”

“But you said it!” She looks towards their hands, she couldn’t help but feel how it felt so right, “what about Jasmine?”

Peter sighed, “I was just playing along because I was afraid of your feelings towards me.”

Olivia chuckled, “funny, I had this huge crush on you when I first met you and I’d be lying if I said I still didn’t have one.”

Peter perked up, “are you saying…”

“I’m saying that my feelings towards you might be the same.”

“Might?”

“I’m trying to indicate that if we do anything about this,” she picked up their hands that were not intertwined, “I want to take it slow, especially with everything going on.”

Peter gave her an understanding nod, “I can do slow.”

“This doesn’t mean I’m not angry at you anymore for beating up Bren!” Olivia said sternly.

Peter smiles, “admit it, you think he deserved it.”

Olivia sighed, “yeah, he did but it was kind of reckless, Peter. What if my dad didn’t show up? What then?”

“Bren would be dead,” Peter mumbled.

Olivia rolled her eyes, “or you could’ve gotten hurt! Or thrown into jail!”

“I’m spider-man, I doubt that would happen.”

There was a knock at the door and then Nat peeked her head in, “whoa, we interrupting something?” She raised her eyebrows at the sight of Olivia and Peter holding hands.

“What?” Steve then peaked his head in and saw them holding hands, “whoa, when did this happen?”

Peter let go of Olivia’s hand, “I should probably go get her something to eat.”

“Cheeseburgers please,” Olivia said softly.

Peter smiled, “of course,” he then walked out of the room.

Nat sighed as she walked over to Olivia, placing a hand on her cheek, “you scared us, Liv.”

Steve stood on the other side of the bed, “you could’ve gone to me or Nat, Liv.”

“I went to a lot of people,” Olivia began to say, “I was so deep in this hole… I didn’t see a way out. I’m sorry.”

“Oh, Liv, there’s always a way out that doesn’t include this,” Nat said as she pulled the girl into an embrace.

Olivia let out a small sob, “I felt so empty, Nat,” She exclaimed, “I went to Jasmine and then she listened to the rumors at school! She said I probably wanted it!”

Nat gently brushed Olivia’s hair, in order to calm the young girl down, “shhh,” Nat gently said as she placed a kiss on the girl’s hair.

“Rumors?” Steve questioned.

Olivia gave him a nod as her sobs decreased, “Bren started telling everyone at school that I wanted to have sex with him.”

Steve began to think that Peter did the right thing to beat the kid up, “have you told your dad this?” Olivia shook her head.

“Liv, we need you to tell your father everything that happened, we need you to trust us,” Nat said softly.

Olivia sighed, “I know, I just… it’s gonna break him.”

“But he has to know, sweetie,” Nat wiped away a tear from the girl’s cheek. Nat quickly placed a finger to her ear, “We’ll be there,” she said silently as she looked at Steve who just gave her a small nod, “we’ve been called for a quick mission, but we’ll be back tomorrow.”

“Hopefully you’ll be out by then,” Steve added with a small smile.

“Hopefully,” Olivia said.

“We should get going,” Nat said to Steve. Nat gave Olivia a quick hug and kiss on the cheek before walking away.  

Steve gave the girl a reassuring smile, Olivia held onto his hand, “can you tell Bucky that I want to see him?”

Steve gave her a small nod, “of course.” He kissed her on the top of her head before walking out of the room.

Bucky sat not too far from the room, watching as Nat and Steve walked out. He sighed to himself, he should’ve gone home with Sam, he thought. Steve strolled over to Bucky, “She wants to see you,” he whispered.

Bucky shook his head, “I-”

“You’re bound to see her sooner or later, pal. Might as well make it sooner. Get it over with,” Steve said as he placed a reassuring hand on Bucky’s shoulder.

Bucky knew that Steve was right, he looked over at the door, letting out a heavy sigh before getting up. He made his way over to the room, slowly opening the door, he walked in. Tears instantly welling up in his eyes, thoughts coming back from yesterday, he was holding her in his arms trying to save her life.

“Bucky,” Olivia said softly, noticing his reaction.

Bucky didn’t say anything he quickly walked over to the young girl and enveloping her into a hug, “Never do that again, doll,” he said softly. He had already lost his younger sister and he couldn’t lose another.

Earning ‘ooooo’s from everyone in the room, “someone’s in trouble,” Nat said as she took a sip of her coffee.

i love you three thousand

summary: peace
title: peace
body:
short fic i did last night when i was listening to truce and crying over tony and nat. enjoy lads, and feedback most welcome :) 














Mr Stark? Mr Stark, can you hear me? It’s Peter.

We won. We won Mr Stark. I’m sorry, Tony…

Tony, look at me. We’re gonna be okay.

You can rest now.

I love you three thousand.

His eyes were closed, but it wasn’t dark.

He felt light, almost like he was floating. Like he didn’t carry the weight of any responsibility.

He opened his eyes.

It wasn’t blinding, but everything was bright, not harshly bright, but calm. He sat up, aware of his surroundings, but not overwhelmed. He was on a grassy bank in front of the most calm and perfectly coloured lake he could never have pictured before seeing it. In the distance, mountains rose above the water, mountains so grand and green that he thought perhaps he was only making things up, but he couldn’t have made up a view like that. The water and mountains and grass stretched as far as the eye could see, and he saw no one else, but he felt completely safe.

He stood up and walked down to the lake, hesitantly, he reached out a hand to touch the water lightly with his finger tips, feeling the perfect temperature. A hundred tiny, silver trigger fish swam past his hands, brushing them lightly. He sat down, putting his feet in the water, realising for the first time his face and body were clean. He was in only a white shirt and blue jeans, perhaps the most simple outfit he had been caught in since he had lived in the peak of childhood innocence.

Staring around, he had never felt more peaceful. He could feel the memories of what had happened in his head, but they didn’t weigh him down. He knew he wasn’t alive, wherever he was, but he was content in feeling this way so he didn’t feel an intense desire to find out.

His feet in the water, he felt no weight in his body at all, and he didn’t recognise the feeling, like it had been years since he had been fully relieved of obligations. The sounds around him were natural; birds calling to each other quietly; the water lapping gently at the base of the bank and around his ankles, the grass rustling under his hands as they moved. He heard all this as he remembered the events that had led him here, but they weren’t overtaking the sounds of peace around him. It was warm. There was a sun in the sky. There was no wind.

Then, there were voices.

They didn’t come all at once, they came one at a time, the next over taking the first, but he could hear each one clearly. They didn’t overwhelm him or take over the sounds of nature that surrounded him, but they co existed, just like with his thoughts.

First it was Clint. Then Bruce. James. Steve. Happy. Peter. Morgan. Pepper. With each voice came a new sentence, but what they were saying didn’t seem important. Their voices, he could hear their voices, and his heart was filled with emotion and nothing but good memories. Tears fell down his cheeks, but they weren’t tears of loss or pain. They were the feeling of being whole, the feeling of peace and serenity with the voices of those most important to him surrounding him. They didn’t overwhelm him or deafen him, they were just there. He stared up at the blue sky, the sun warming his back and he sat there, the tears continuing to fall and heal him.

He was still sitting there when he heard another voice. It wasn’t clearer than the rest, and it didn’t scare the rest away, they were still there, but it was meant to be heard.

“Tony.”

He turned around, and Natasha stood above him, he cheeks glistening with the tears that had brought her peace too, and a smile he was sure was as wide as his. He stood up to embrace her.

“Nat.”

They held each other tightly for a moment, then they broke apart. She was wearing a black singlet and jeans, her feet bare too, and her red hair flowing out over her shoulders.

They sat down together, up to their ankles in the water, staring at the hills.

After a small silence, she looked at him.

“What are you thinking about?” She asked him, and he looked back at her.

“My family.”

She smiled.

“You?”

She thought for a moment. “That I did the right thing.”

They were quiet again.

They were lying down on the bank later when Tony spoke.

“Do you know where we are?”

She shook her head, staring up at the most brilliant sunset Tony had ever seen, and her face reflected the pink and orange beautifully, making her glow in a whole new light.

“Do you want to know?” He asked. And she thought for a moment.

“No. Is that strange?”

“No,” he replied. “I don’t either.”

They watched the sun continue to set, and right as it started to fall behind the hills, Nat stood up, reaching out a hand to pull up Tony.

“Where are we going?” He asked her, as they clasped hands and began to walk in the direction Nat had come from.

She considered her reply for a moment, then looked out to the indescribable landscape ahead of them.

“That way.”

“No. Is that strange?”

“No,” he replied. “I don’t either.”

She considered her reply for a moment, then looked out to the indescribable landscape ahead of them.

“That way.”

summary: Steve dying would've made more sense
body:
Steve dying would’ve made more sense

He’s already said he can’t see himself settling down and having a family. His ending with Peggy just feels lame. He’s literally getting with her and erasing the fact that she had a family and moved on from him!

In Ca:Tfa he throws himself onto what he believes is a grenade in order to save everyone else. Unless we are to believe Steve’s characterization so far is meant to be seen as a noble man spiraling downward into being a liar and an awful friend, then it’s fair to assume he’s still so selfless he’d be willing to die for everybody. He already acts like he’s got nothing but Bucky to live for.

Meanwhile, Tony’s arc is literally him learning he doesn’t need to put his life on the line, hurt himself, and fall prey to his mental health, all for the sake of the world, and to ease the guilt he feels. He learns he can SETTLE DOWN AND HAVE A FAMILY.

We don’t even get to see the culmination of Tony’s arc, we don’t get to watch him get his family, or have a large amount of the movie devoted to that no, that development happens off screen. And we get teased with it, for fan service, but we never see his arc come to fruition.

If he’d had time where we felt he’d managed to finally settle down, and where we felt that five years of peace had really passed for tony stark, we might’ve felt satisfied. Instead, Avengers Endgame feels like a tragedy rather than a victory.

In Ca:Tfa he throws himself onto what he believes is a grenade in order to save everyone else. Unless we are to believe Steve’s characterization so far is meant to be seen as a noble man spiraling downward into being a liar and an awful friend, then it’s fair to assume he’s still so selfless he’d be willing to die for everybody. He already acts like he’s got nothing but Bucky to live for.

Meanwhile, Tony’s arc is literally him learning he doesn’t need to put his life on the line, hurt himself, and fall prey to his mental health, all for the sake of the world, and to ease the guilt he feels. He learns he can SETTLE DOWN AND HAVE A FAMILY.

We don’t even get to see the culmination of Tony’s arc, we don’t get to watch him get his family, or have a large amount of the movie devoted to that no, that development happens off screen. And we get teased with it, for fan service, but we never see his arc come to fruition.

If he’d had time where we felt he’d managed to finally settle down, and where we felt that five years of peace had really passed for tony stark, we might’ve felt satisfied. Instead, Avengers Endgame feels like a tragedy rather than a victory.
